Saturday had finally arrived.%K%P
I'd made an effort to look a little more\nstylish than usual for my date with Sara.%K%P
This was going to be my first ever date.\nAnd I understood that the girl I was meeting was\nout of my league.%K%P
When I arrived at Akihabara Station,\nI realized just how careless I'd been.%K%P
The air around Sara was charged with nervous energy.%K%P
She wasn't incognito or anything,\njust standing around like it was a normal day.\nNaturally, a lot of people had noticed she was there.%K%P
But there was something about her that made her hard\nto approach. As a result, she was now surrounded\nby a crowd of fans.%K%P
'Ah, Yamato!'%K%P
Sara said as she noticed and called out to me.%K%P
Her entourage shifted, and I felt everyone's gaze\non me. No one could believe I was the one she\nwas meeting. Their glares got more and more hostile.%K%P
'You know, I'm not so sure about this...'%K%P
'Hm? What's wrong?'%K%P
'It's just that there's so many of your fans here...'%K%P
'You shouldn't worry about that.\nI'm not a Divine Idol anymore, after all.'%K%P
'But if it bothers you that much,\nI did bring along something that might help.'%K%P
Sara took something out\nof her bag and handed it to me.%K%P
'It's a video camera.\nThis way you can film me, and everyone will\njust think I'm shooting something for a show.'%K%P
'Oh, right...'%K%P
Sure, it'd give us some privacy,\nbut it wouldn't feel much like a date.%K%P
Then again, without a gimmick like this,\nwalking around Akiba wouldn't be easy.%K%P
'I think we'll be fine without it,\nbut it's up to you.'%K%P
'Since you brought it along, we might as well use it.\nUntil the crowd thins out a little, anyway.'%K%P
'Sounds good.\nWe'll just have to be patient until they calm down.'%K%P
Having decided on our game plan, I started filming.%K%P
Sara and I moved onto Akihabara's main street.%K%P
Anyone who saw us assumed I was just a cameraman\nand mostly left us alone.%K%P
'Hmm, just filming like this isn't very exciting,\nis it?'%K%P
'We could do something that\nlooks more like a show segment, I guess.'%K%P
'Good idea.\nActually, there is something I'd like to do.'%K%P
'A grand tour of Akihabara's curry houses!'%K%P
The curry restaurants in this area\nwere always in fierce competition.%K%P
And there was no shortage of places to choose from.\nThere were citywide chains, nationwide chains,\nand smaller local shops, too.%K%P
'I've always wanted to do a proper tour of them.\nWhat do you think? Can we give it a try?'%K%P
'Sure.\nWe'll act like we're shooting for\nsome kind of food travel show.'%K%P
My plans for a fun date had\nbeen derailed pretty fast.%K%P
But when I saw Sara's cheerful smile,\nnone of that small stuff seemed to matter anymore.%K%P
'I thought we might end up doing this,\nso I did a little research in advance.\nLet's get moving to our first stop.'%K%P
We started with a fairly well known chain restaurant\nthat wasn't too far off.%K%P
After getting permission from the staff,\nwe started shooting.%K%P
'H-How is it?'%K%P
'70/100!\nI know the portion size is their selling point,\nbut I think they used too many fried ingredients.'%K%P
It didn't sound like a great rating,\nas far as Sara was concerned.%K%P
'But it certainly was delicious.\nEven the chain stores in Akihabara\naren't to be trifled with.'%K%P
'You finished the whole thing, too.'%K%P
She had been given quite the serving,\nbut her plate was completely clean now.%K%P
'It would be rude to leave anything.'%K%P
'I guess, but don't push yourself, okay?\nIf you're struggling I can always take what's left.'%K%P
'Ah, then we can use a line like,\n'Our staff all agreed it tasted great!''%K%P
'I'm not sure if we can say 'staff'\nwhen it's only me.'%K%P
'In that case I'll have to do my best to make sure\nyou don't get stuck with too many leftovers.'%K%P
Sara clenched her fists and nodded\nwith a cute kind of determination.%K%P
She had such a slim figure,\nbut she could really put food away.%K%P
When she ate at my house, she always had extra\nhelpings. I had a feeling that together, we\ncould visit a good number of restaurants.%K%P
We left and went to another place,\nthen another after that.%K%P
'All right, this is our next stop.'%K%P
Sara pointed to a sign that read\nGoddess Cafe 'Amano Kaguyama'.%K%P
'Here? I thought we were going to curry houses.\nThis is the place where Kagura works.'%K%P
'Places like this are hidden gems.\nSometimes they serve handmade curry\nthat's better than you might expect.'%K%P
I'd never ordered the curry here,\nso I had no idea how good it might be.%K%P
'Let's give it a try!'%K%P
Amano Kaguyama was a cafe specifically geared toward\nfans of Divine Idols.%K%P
So what would happen if Sara went inside?\nIf only I'd stopped to think about that for a second.\nBut I didn't and we just barged right in.%K%P
'Whoooa! It's Sara Benzaiten!'%K%P
'I never thought I'd actually get to see you\nin a backwater place like this!\nOohhh! My lady, I'll never forget this day!'%K%P
Tears in his eyes, the customer dropped to his knees\nand bowed before Sara.%K%P
To be honest the sight of it made me cringe,\nbut Sara just nodded politely as if\nthis happened to her all the time.%K%P
'Wow, so we're a backwater place, huh...'%K%P
Kagura wasn't very impressed.%K%P
'Sorry about this, Kagura.\nI didn't mean to cause so much of a fuss.'%K%P
'It's good business for us,\nso don't worry about it.'%K%P
News of Sara making the rounds of curry restaurants\nwas probably spreading as we spoke.%K%P
I took out my own phone to check,\nbut right then Kagura jabbed me in the side.%K%P
'Yamato, what gives?\nWhy'd you bring Sara here?'%K%P
'Ow! Sorry.\nShe said she wanted to try the curry here...'%K%P
'Hi there, everyone!\nSorry about the filming.\nPlease don't let it disturb you.'%K%P
'Woo hoo!'%K%P
Sara practically was their goddess\nand fired up by her words, the customers all rose\nand gave Sara a standing ovation.%K%P
'Wow, Sara's really something.\nI'm still no match for her.'%K%P
'I agree. Sorry, but it's no contest at all.'%K%P
Right now Love☆Kami had no chance\nof causing a sensation like this.%K%P
Even after leaving L☆SEVEN,\nSara was still a huge presence\nin the Divine Idol world.%K%P
'Let's do this nice and quick\nbefore we cause any more trouble.'%K%P
Sara ran her eyes down the menu,\nsubjecting it to careful scrutiny.%K%P
'I see you have several kinds of curry here.\nWhich one would you recommend?'%K%P
'This one's the most popular.\nThe Omelette Cutlet Victory Curry!'%K%P
'Okay, one of those, please!'%K%P
I don't know what it had to do with victory,\nbut it sounded like we'd get a lot of curry.%K%P
'Are you sure you can handle it all on your own?'%K%P
'I can still manage!'%K%P
Sara made sure to emphasize her big appetite.%K%P
She'd already eaten tons,\nbut she was still willing to keep up the pace.%K%P
'Here you go!\nOne Omelette Cutlet Victory Curry!'%K%P
Kagura set down a gargantuan plate in front of Sara.%K%P
'Oh my, this certainly is a generous helping...'%K%P
It was about three times as big as a regular order\nof curry. Not only that, but it was also topped\nwith an omelette and a pork cutlet.%K%P
'Are you really sure about this?\nI can help you out if you like...'%K%P
'I'm fine.\nAt least let me see how far I can get on my own.'%K%P
It felt like we'd suddenly entered\nan eating competition.%K%P
The cafe's customers gathered around to\nwitness the challenge.%K%P
'Here I go...!'%K%P
And she was off!%K%P
Sara started eating, with every sign of enjoyment.%K%P
But after five minutes, she put her spoon down.%K%P
'...Phew.'%K%P
'Seriously, you don't need to force yourself.'%K%P
'I... I can still...'%K%P
'No, you can't. Let me handle the rest.'%K%P
'I'll help too.'%K%P
'Thank you, both of you.'%K%P
Sara had only managed to eat a third of it.\nKagura and I worked together,\nand somehow managed to finish what was left.%K%P
Sara announced the curry's score in a strained voice.%K%P
'There really was too much of it, huh?'%K%P
'There's nothing wrong with a large portion.\nBut I think the pre-fried cutlet was a bit...'%K%P
They probably never made the effort to fry one\nfreshly for every order. Eating that on top\nof the curry would make anyone feel bloated.%K%P
'The curry was pre-made, too.\nI know the Goddess Cafe's are on a tight budget,\nbut there's nothing quite like the homemade variety.'%K%P
Cutting corners wouldn't curry any favor with Sara.%K%P
Sara was still giving scores to restaurants even\nthough we had gotten away from the center of town,\nwhich told me she was still being rather cautious.%K%P
'I think that's enough...\nWe don't need to film anymore.'%K%P
I switched off the video camera and gave it back.%K%P
'Yes, I don't think I could eat another bite.\nGuess that's a wrap.'%K%P
She took the camera and let out a sigh.%K%P
We'd gotten sidetracked with this curry adventure,\nbut that wasn't what today was supposed to be about.%K%P
I was quite a long ways away\nfrom teaching Sara about love.%K%P
'Is there anywhere you'd like to go?'%K%P
As long as we were in Akihabara, it'd be hard to\nescape Sara's identity as a former Divine Idol.%K%P
We'd need to get away from her wild fans\nif she was going to be a normal girl again.%K%P
'You'd let me choose?'%K%P
'I'm not saying we can go anywhere,\nbut I'll do my best.'%K%P
Anywhere that's not here.\nIf it was somewhere Sara wanted to be,\nI couldn't ask for anything more.%K%P
'In that case, I do have one request.'%K%P
'We'll have to walk for a while from here, though.\nIs that okay?'%K%P
We headed north along Kuramaebashi\nand through Yushima.%K%P
The walk took almost 20 minutes.%K%P
A little ways past Yushima Tenmangu Shrine\nwas an oasis in the middle of the city.%K%P
'I always feel so relaxed when I come here.'%K%P
Shinobazu Pond spread out across the west side\nof Ueno Park. The lotuses must have been\nin season as the flowers were blooming all around us.%K%P
In the middle of the lake was the Bentendou temple,\nwhere Benzaiten is enshrined.%K%P
As a Wakemitama of Benzaiten,\nSara must've felt a strong connection to this place.%K%P
'While we're here, I may as well let my hair down.'%K%P
With a graceful wave of her hands,\nSara's outfit instantly changed.%K%P
She changed from a simple girl into a true goddess.%K%P
A smile spread across her face,\nbanishing any feelings of gloom that\nmight have rested in her heart.%K%P
'Look, Yamato.\nAren't the lotus flowers pretty?'%K%P
There were lotuses all over the surface of the pond,\nbut right now they were just something to\ndecorate the background.%K%P
That's how wonderful Sara's smile was.%K%P
'I do like it in Akihabara, but I'm not very good\nwith crowds. I feel much more at ease in places\nlike this, that are full of nature.'%K%P
The water from the lake. The lotus flowers.\nThe lines of willow trees.\nIt was like they were all giving Sara new vitality.%K%P
Her face was now alight and full of life,\nher previously tired expression gone without a trace.%K%P
'So beautiful...'%K%P
I forgot myself and let my feelings slip out.%K%P
'It really is. This is a very beautiful place.'%K%P
That's not what I meant.\nIt was Sara who was beautiful.%K%P
I didn't want to get in the way as she danced around,\nand ended up just staring, dumbstruck.%K%P
'Heehee. It's been a while since I've been able to\ncut loose like this.'%K%P
'Thank you, Yamato.\nConsider this a show of thanks.'%K%P
Sara's gestures started getting larger.%K%P
I heard bells ringing, though I could have sworn\na moment ago, there weren't any there.%K%P
And in an instant, shimmering drops of water\nscattered all around us.%K%P
'Wow...'%K%P
It was a miracle. Something only a god could do.\nThe way the water and lights moved\nilluminated Sara vividly.%K%P
And right in the center of it all was Sara.\nHer radiant beauty was just as dazzling\nas when she'd been in L☆SEVEN.%K%P
'Mmm hm-hhmm'%K%P
Sara's mood improved even more,\nand she started to dance.%K%P
Like she had truly come from a higher plane.%K%P
I'd never seen anyone dance so beautifully,\nand yet, in the corner of my mind,\nthere was a sharp reminder of regret.%K%P
If only I could hear her sing.%K%P
I just couldn't help wishing for that.%K%P
And Sara still hadn't recovered her singing voice.%K%P
I'd been so sure that she'd be able to sing again\nif she grew to understand love,\nbut how much did I really believe that?%K%P
If it didn't turn out that way,\nI couldn't imagine how much it would hurt.%K%P
My date with Sara may not have started out smoothly,\nbut soon enough, it settled into something natural.%K%P
After strolling around Shinobazu Pond,\nwe wandered around the Ueno Zoo and the museum.\nWe had a really fun afternoon together.%K%P
The time flew by, and soon enough the sun had set.%K%P
We took that as our cue to head back to Akihabara.%K%P
'Thank you for everything today, Yamato.\nToday was a nice change of pace.'%K%P
Sara thanked me one more time,\nas if to draw the day's proceedings to a close.%K%P
'Same here. I had a lot of fun,\nand I'm glad I got to see a new side of you.'%K%P
The extent of what I knew\nabout Sara was pretty limited.%K%P
I knew her as a customer at our store, and as a\nmember of L☆SEVEN. But I'd never had any\nopportunities to get to know her in any other ways.%K%P
'Aw, that's not fair.\nYou've just been the same old you today.'%K%P
'Yeah, I guess I'm always the same\nwhen I'm around you.'%K%P
Maybe I acted a little different around\nShuri or Kagura.\nBut with Sara, that was a whole other story.%K%P
'Does that mean there's no way\nfor me to see you in a new light?'%K%P
'I guess not...'%K%P
'Not if things stay as they are, that is.'%K%P
'But maybe...'%K%P
A sudden blast of sound cut me off.%K%P
At the same time, the big screen on the building\nbehind Sara flooded with light.%K%P
'Yamato, is this...'%K%P
'Don't look!'%K%P
The video on-screen was of the new L☆SEVEN.%K%P
There was no need for her to see it right now.%K%P
'Still worried about me, huh? Thank you.'%K%P
'But it's okay. I can tell even without looking.\nThis is the song we'd been practicing.'%K%P
The song we'd been practicing.\nThat's what she said all right.%K%P
Even after retiring, L☆SEVEN's songs were\nstill her group's songs.%K%P
Somehow, that made me really happy.\nI felt so much joy welling up inside, I was shaking.%K%P
'I won't pretend I have no regrets.\nI'd still be in L☆SEVEN now, if I could.'%K%P
'But there's no value in a Divine Idol\nthat can't sing.'%K%P
'Tell me... What is love...?'%K%P
'No one ever taught me what it was. But I guess that\nmakes sense. It's only been a year since I manifested\nas a Wakemitama.'%K%P
I'd always thought of Sara as an older sister type,\nsomeone who knew everything.%K%P
Maybe I'd let myself get blinded by her divinity.%K%P
But the reality was that she hadn't even been here\nfor two years, yet. And she wasn't the only one.\nIt was the same for all the goddesses.%K%P
'Lady Amaterasu said as much. She said we didn't know\nanything about human society, that we were just like\nchildren. And that we needed a place to learn.'%K%P
'That's how the Divine Education Act was passed.\nBut no one ever taught us how to understand\nhuman emotions.'%K%P
'We may be gods, but as humans\nwe're just pale imitations.\nBut I doubt anyone has noticed that yet...'%K%P
'Humans fall in love with each other so naturally.\nI'm not even sure I can feel that way about someone.'%K%P
'Someone has to teach us.\nWhat is love? How does it feel to love someone?'%K%P
What is love?\nHow does it feel to love someone?%K%P
I didn't have enough experience\nto put something like that into words.%K%P
But maybe this burning sensation I felt inside\nwas what people call love.%K%P
If it was, I knew I could tell Sara what it meant.%K%P
'Sara...'%K%P
I took a step forward.%K%P
It was only a single step,\nbut it was so very important that I took it.%K%P
'I don't know enough about the world to\nteach anyone what love means.'%K%P
'But I think I can handle\ntelling you how I'm feeling right now.'%K%P
'Sara, I like you. No, I love you!'%K%P
'Y-Yamato? You...love me?'%K%P
Sara looked shocked.\nI don't think she saw that coming.%K%P
'I guess you didn't notice.\nDid you think we were just hanging out today?'%K%P
'Weren't we? That's what you said in your text...'%K%P
'I wanted this to be a date.\nI've liked you for so long, Sara.'%K%P
It wouldn't be right for me to try to explain romance\nwhen I'd never experienced love.%K%P
But maybe now things could be different.\nI felt like I could understand love too,\nif I was with Sara.%K%P
The seeds of this feeling planted deep in my heart,\nwere now starting to bloom.%K%P
'And Sara... How do you feel about me...?'%K%P
'This is all so sudden...'%K%P
She wasn't ready.\nBut I don't think anyone ever is\nwhen it comes to love.%K%P
'But if I just sit here being surprised,\nnothing will happen, will it?'\nI just need a moment to process all this.'%K%P
'To be honest, I'm really surprised that you feel\nthat way but... It's not a bad feeling.\nI feel sort of warm and fluffy inside.'%K%P
'It must be your Sakimitama\nmaking me feel so good.'%K%P
'Yamato Tatsumi, your Sakimitama\nhas something that really comforts me.\nI think that means our emotions are connected.'%K%P
'I still don't know all that much about love\nor romance.\nBut I like the idea of us having a future together.'%K%P
'So... Well, I think, maybe...'%K%P
'I like you too, Yamato.'%K%P
'I hope I get to spend lots more time with you as...\nMy boyfriend.'%K%P
That night, Sara and I became\ngirlfriend and boyfriend.%K%P
